text: Formula One, commonly known as F1, is the highest class of international single-seater auto racing sanctioned by the FIA.
The Formula One World Championship was inaugurated in 1950 and has since become one of the most popular sporting series globally.
Scuderia Ferrari is the oldest surviving and most successful Formula One team, having competed since the first season in 1950.
Mercedes-AMG Petronas Formula One Team dominated the hybrid era from 2014 to 2020, winning multiple Constructors' Championships.
Red Bull Racing, powered primarily by Renault and later Honda engines, rose to prominence with Sebastian Vettel in the early 2010s.
McLaren is a British Formula One team known for technological innovation and the legendary partnership of Ayrton Senna and Alain Prost.
Williams Racing, founded by Sir Frank Williams, has won multiple Constructors' and Drivers' Championships in the 1980s and 1990s.
Alpine F1 Team, previously known as Renault, has a long history in Formula One and won titles with Fernando Alonso in 2005 and 2006.
Aston Martin re-entered Formula One in 2021 and rapidly expanded its performance with strong results from driver Fernando Alonso.
The Alfa Romeo F1 Team previously operated under the name Sauber and has a long history of developing young driver talent.
The Haas F1 Team, founded in 2016, is the first American-led Formula One team in decades.
Scuderia AlphaTauri, previous known as Toro Rosso, served as Red Bull Racing's junior development team for young drivers.
Sebastian Vettel is a four-time Formula One World Champion, winning his titles consecutively from 2010 to 2013 with Red Bull.
Lewis Hamilton is a seven-time World Champion known for his dominance with Mercedes and his record for most race wins in F1 history.
Michael Schumacher held the record for seven World Championships and is considered one of the greatest Formula One drivers.
Fernando Alonso is a two-time World Champion, recognized for exceptional racecraft and longevity across multiple teams.
Max Verstappen became the youngest driver to start an F1 race and later won multiple World Championships with Red Bull.
Charles Leclerc is a leading driver for Ferrari known for his qualifying speed and strong race pace.
Lando Norris, driving for McLaren, is widely regarded as one of the strongest young talents in modern F1.
George Russell joined Mercedes as a full-time race driver in 2022 after excelling at Williams.
Sergio Pérez is a Mexican Formula One driver known for his tire management skills and victories with Racing Point and Red Bull.
Daniel Ricciardo is known for his overtaking ability, especially his late-braking 'divebomb' moves.
Ayrton Senna is considered one of the greatest drivers in Formula One history, especially known for his qualifying speed and wet-weather skills.
Alain Prost, known as 'The Professor', won four Formula One World Championships during the 1980s and early 1990s.
Niki Lauda won three World Championships and is remembered for his comeback after a near-fatal crash in 1976.
The Monaco Grand Prix is the most iconic Formula One race, known for its tight street circuit and glamorous atmosphere.
The Italian Grand Prix at Monza is one of the oldest races and is known as the 'Temple of Speed' due to its long high-speed straights.
The British Grand Prix at Silverstone hosted the very first Formula One World Championship race in 1950.
The Belgian Grand Prix at Spa-Francorchamps is famous for the Eau Rouge and Raidillon corner combination.
The Singapore Grand Prix was the first night race in Formula One, introduced in 2008.
The Japanese Grand Prix at Suzuka is a driver favorite known for its figure-eight layout and technical corners.
Pole position is awarded to the driver who sets the fastest lap time during qualifying ahead of the race.
DRS, or Drag Reduction System, increases top speed by reducing aerodynamic drag when activated under specific race conditions.
The safety car neutralizes a race when an accident or hazard requires reducing the speed of competing cars.
Formula One cars use hybrid power units combining an internal combustion engine with energy recovery systems.
Pirelli is the exclusive tire supplier for Formula One, providing multiple tire compounds with varying grip and durability.
Overtaking in Formula One is influenced by aerodynamics, tire conditions, track layout, and car performance.
Pit stops in Formula One involve tire changes and occasionally wing adjustments, typically completed in under three seconds.
The Constructors' Championship is awarded to the team that accumulates the most points across the season.
The Drivers' Championship is awarded to the driver with the most points from race results throughout the season.
Points in Formula One are awarded to the top ten finishers, with 25 points given for a race victory.
The FIA enforces technical and sporting regulations to maintain safety and competitive fairness in Formula One.
Wind tunnels and CFD simulations are critical for developing a Formula One car's aerodynamic performance.
Ground-effect aerodynamics re-emerged in Formula One in 2022 with new regulations to improve close racing.
Formula One has a cost cap designed to reduce spending disparities between teams and improve competition.
The 2021 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix was one of the most controversial races in F1 history due to safety car procedures.
Kimi Räikkönen, known as 'The Iceman', won the 2007 World Championship with Ferrari.
Jenson Button won the 2009 World Championship with Brawn GP, a team that existed for only one season.
Brawn GP was formed after Honda withdrew from F1 and became the only team to win both titles in its debut season.
Ross Brawn is a renowned engineer and team leader who played key roles at Ferrari, Brawn GP, and Mercedes.
Pierre Gasly won his first Formula One race at the 2020 Italian Grand Prix driving for AlphaTauri.
The Red Bull Ring in Austria is known for its elevation changes and fast corners.
Lewis Hamilton and Nico Rosberg had a tense rivalry during their years as Mercedes teammates.
The Canadian Grand Prix in Montreal is famous for the Wall of Champions, which has claimed multiple world champions.
The United States Grand Prix at Circuit of the Americas features elevation changes and signature corners inspired by classic circuits.
The Melbourne Grand Prix Circuit at Albert Park traditionally opens the Formula One season.
Mick Schumacher, son of Michael Schumacher, competed in Formula One with Haas.
Yuki Tsunoda is the first Japanese driver to score points in Formula One since Kamui Kobayashi.
Oscar Piastri is an emerging talent at McLaren who won Formula 2 and Formula 3 in consecutive years.
Logan Sargeant became the first American Formula One driver since Alexander Rossi to race full-time.
Formula One's sprint race format awards additional points and provides an extra competitive session on select weekends.
Safety improvements in Formula One include the halo device, improved crash structures, and stricter circuit standards.
The Bahrain Grand Prix was the first Formula One race held in the Middle East, debuting in 2004.
The Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya is known for its aerodynamic demands, making it a benchmark testing venue.
The Mexican Grand Prix at Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez features a high-altitude environment affecting engine performance.
The Brazilian Grand Prix at Interlagos is famous for dramatic title deciders, including the 2008 and 2012 races.
The Chinese Grand Prix at the Shanghai International Circuit joined the Formula One calendar in 2004.
The Abu Dhabi Grand Prix at Yas Marina Circuit is known for its twilight-to-night race atmosphere.
The Dutch Grand Prix at Zandvoort returned to the F1 calendar in 2021 with heavily banked corners.
The Hungarian Grand Prix at Hungaroring is a tight and twisty track that rewards strong qualifying performance.
The Austrian Grand Prix at the Red Bull Ring is known for short lap times and close field spreads.
The Qatar Grand Prix debuted in 2021 and features a high-speed circuit originally designed for MotoGP.
Formula One introduced hybrid power units in 2014, combining a turbocharged V6 engine with advanced energy recovery systems.
ERS, or Energy Recovery System, captures kinetic and heat energy to convert into electric power for acceleration.
MGU-K recovers energy during braking, while MGU-H recovers heat energy from the turbocharger in F1 power units.
Teams use simulators extensively to train drivers and test setups before race weekends.
The FIA stewards enforce penalties for unsafe driving, track limit violations, and technical infringements.
Formula One cars generate downforce to increase grip in corners, enabling high-speed performance.
Dirty air from the car ahead reduces downforce for the pursuing car, making overtaking more difficult.
The introduction of ground-effect regulations in 2022 aimed to improve racing by reducing sensitivity to dirty air.
The F1 cost cap introduced in 2021 limits team spending to promote competitive balance.
A Formula One race weekend consists of practice sessions, qualifying, and the main race.
Qualifying is divided into Q1, Q2, and Q3, progressively eliminating slower cars.
Wet-weather tires in F1 include intermediate and full-wet compounds for different rain intensities.
Slick tires have no tread and provide maximum grip in dry conditions due to increased contact area.
The pit lane speed limit is enforced to maintain safety for mechanics and team personnel.
Race strategy in Formula One includes tire choices, pit stop timing, and fuel management.
Slipstreaming allows a trailing car to reduce drag by following a leading car closely.
Understeer occurs when a car turns less than intended, while oversteer happens when the rear steps out.
Telemetry systems transmit live car data to engineers for analysis during sessions.
The Formula One World Drivers' Championship has been awarded annually since 1950.
The youngest Formula One world champion is Sebastian Vettel, who won his first title at age 23.
The fastest ever recorded F1 speed in a race was set by Valtteri Bottas at the 2016 Mexican Grand Prix.
Valtteri Bottas is a Finnish driver known for strong qualifying performances and contributions to Mercedes' success.
Carlos Sainz Jr. races for Ferrari and achieved his first Formula One victory at the 2022 British Grand Prix.
Esteban Ocon claimed his maiden Formula One win at the 2021 Hungarian Grand Prix driving for Alpine.
Kevin Magnussen achieved his first pole position in Formula One at the 2022 Brazilian Grand Prix.
Nyck de Vries made his Formula One debut in 2022, scoring points in his first race with Williams.
Alex Albon is a Thai-British driver racing for Williams known for his defensive driving skills.
Guanyu Zhou became the first Chinese driver to race full-time in Formula One when he debuted in 2022.
Haas became the first American-led F1 team since 1986 when it joined the grid in 2016.
Formula One uses a points system awarding the top ten drivers, with additional points for the fastest lap.
